result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Sexual Contact with Child Age 15, Actor Under 19

10:02 AM Defendant Yadel L Cruz in court.  Attorney Luis Daniel Gutierrez in court for Yadel L Cruz.  Prosecuting attorney Andrew Nesheim in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Victim rights have been complied with by the Waukesha County District Attorneys Office. 
Atty Gutierrez requests a plea and sentencing date.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 7, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on December 7, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Yadel L Cruz in court.  Attorney Luis Daniel Gutierrez in court for Yadel L Cruz. 
Victim rights have been complied with by the Waukesha County District Attorneys Office. 
Atty Gutierrez requests a new date.
Hearing scheduled for October 26, 2022 at 09:30 am.

01:37 PM Defendant Yadel L Cruz in court with attorney Luis Daniel Gutierrez.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney Gutierrez is requesting a new date for status to obtain additional discovery and to further investigate.  Hearing scheduled for August 29, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Defendant to have no contact with Victim A/Victim B/Victim C listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.

08:55 AM Defendant Yadel L Cruz in court with attorney Luis Daniel Gutierrez.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern Jack Rieder appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  The Court orders Document 11 shall be sealed.  Hearing scheduled for July 14, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
